you_could_do_this.title: Minimalism Cures Boredom
you_could_do_this.how: Warm 1 tamal. Paint one stripe of hot mole. Drag the tamal through. One spoon of beans. Stop.

you_could_do_this.title: Crisp & Silk
you_could_do_this.how: Blend beans to latte-silk; salt & strain. Pan-crisp tamal planks. Set crisp on silk; add 5 tiny salsa dots.

you_could_do_this.title: Rice Takes the Throne
you_could_do_this.how: Hot pan → oil → rice → 1–2 tbsp mole + splash water → chopped tamal → finish with salsa.

you_could_do_this.title: Three Faces of Salsa
you_could_do_this.how: Split salsa: plain / whisked with a little mole / folded into mashed beans. Plate as a tiny flight.

you_could_do_this.title: Caramelized Tamal Bites
you_could_do_this.how: Cube tamales; splash citrus or sangria; sear till browned. Pile over rice; thread a thin mole ribbon.

you_could_do_this.title: Crouton Rain
you_could_do_this.how: Dice tamales; fry to crunchy croutons. Rain over beans-and-rice; micro-drizzle mole.

you_could_do_this.title: Inside-Out Patty
you_could_do_this.how: Mash a tamal with a spoon of beans; patty; pan-crisp. Serve on rice; salsa as sauce; mole to finish.

you_could_do_this.title: Two-Line Plate
you_could_do_this.how: Half beans, half rice, one warm tamal. Draw two clean lines—one mole, one salsa. Eat slow.

you_could_do_this.title: Salsa Steam
you_could_do_this.how: Dry-sear tamal planks; kill heat; spoon salsa + water; cover 30s. Serve with a brush of mole.

you_could_do_this.title: Mole Swirl Dip
you_could_do_this.how: Warm mole & salsa. Shallow dish: pour mole, spiral salsa. Dip crisp tamal chunks.

you_could_do_this.title: Rice Balls, Hidden Heart
you_could_do_this.how: Mix rice + mashed beans; hide a tamal cube; pan-sear to a crust. Dip in 50/50 mole–salsa.

you_could_do_this.title: Sweet Heat Brush
you_could_do_this.how: Reduce sangria 2–3 min; brush warm cake slice; add a pinpoint of mole.

you_could_do_this.title: Sangria Snow & Cake Croutons
you_could_do_this.how: Freeze sangria shallow; scrape to granita. Toast cake cubes. Bowl; touch three cubes with tiny mole dots.

you_could_do_this.title: Bean Cream Affogato
you_could_do_this.how: Blend warm beans silky; lightly sweeten with cake-crumb syrup; chill 5 min. Pour hot, thinned mole over a small scoop.

you_could_do_this.title: One-Minute Reset
you_could_do_this.how: Dry-pan crisp tamal edges; kill heat; splash a teaspoon of sangria; pinch salt; serve.

i_wonder: which deserves to be the star tonight—rice, beans, tamal, mole, salsa, or cake? Crown it.
do you want crunch or silk to be loud? Quiet the others.
what’s the tiniest plate that still feels complete? Make exactly that.
who besides you is eating? Change one choice for them—spice, portion, or plating.
could this be only two colors? Pick the two and stay inside them.
which ingredient are you secretly tired of? Leave it out for one plate.
what_if: the sauce was the main course and the solids were garnish?
sweet arrived first and heat arrived last?
everything on the plate came in cubes—even the sauce?
you cooked nothing—only warmed and arranged?
you used your “cheapest” tool to make the fanciest bite?
you served it like street food you could eat walking?
this plate had a rule you could not break?
